comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Lieutenant (Acting Captain) William  Edmund Robarts Blood, Royal Engineers, b. 20th February 1897, son of Colonel W P Blood, educated at Haileybury, RMA Woolwich, Commissioned into the Royal Engineers in 1915.  Awarded several Mentions In Despatches and a Military Cross in the 1914-18 War. Also a Croix de Guerre (France).  A Captain in 1925, he retired from he Army, but was re-called in 1939 for a Special Mission to the United States, to which he was appointed in the rank of Lieutenant Colonel.  In 1941 he was a Temporary Brigadier.  Awarded the Legion of Merit (US) and a CBE in 1943.  He died in 1976.//

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Brigadier William Edmund Robarts Blood was born on 20 February 1897. He was the son of Colonel William Persse Blood and Marienne Frances Robarts. He married, firstly, Eva Gwendoline Harrison, daughter of Edward Walker Harrison, on 7 November 1919. He and Eva Gwendoline Harrison were divorced in 1944. He married, secondly, Janet Edwards, daughter of Colonel William Walter Edwards, on 14 July 1945. He fought in the First World War, wounded, mentioned in despatches. He was decorated with the award of the Croix de Guerre in 1917. He was educated at Imperial Service College, Haileybury, Hertfordshire, England. He was decorated with the award of the Military Cross (M.C.) in 1918. He was educated at Royal Military Academy, Woolwich, Kent, England. He fought in the Second World War. He was invested as a Commander, Order of the British Empire (C.B.E.) in 1943. He was decorated with the award of the U.S. Legion of Merit in 1945. He gained the rank of Brigadier in the service of the Royal Engineers. He was a Director of William Blood, Ltd., building and civil engineering contractors. As of 1976, Brigadier William Edmund Robarts Blood lived at 39 Hans Place, London, England. Child of Brigadier William Edmund Robarts Blood and Eva Gwendoline Harrison: Bindon Blood b. 24 Sep 1920 www.thepeerage.com/p28257.htm#i282569
